revision.text:
{{DISPLAYTITLE: ''Hotel Transylvania'' (franchise)}} {{Infobox media franchise |title = ''Hotel Transylvania'' |image = Hotel Transylvania logo.svg |creator = [[Todd Durham]]{{Cite web|url=http://www.visualhollywood.com/movies_2012/hotel_transylvania/notes.pdf|title=Columbia Pictures Press Kit - Hotel Transylvania|last=|first=|date=|website=|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}} |owner = [[Sony Pictures Animation]] |films = {{Plainlist| * ''[[Hotel Transylvania]]'' (2012) * ''[[Hotel Transylvania 2]]'' (2015) * ''[[Hotel Transylvania 3: Summer Vacation]]'' (2018) }} |novels = {{plainlist| * ''Kakieland Katastrophe'' * ''My Little Monster-Sitter'' * ''Motel Transylvania'' }} |shorts = {{plainlist| * ''[[#Goodnight Mr. Foot|Goodnight Mr. Foot]]'' (2012) * ''[[#Puppy!|Puppy!]]'' (2017) }} |tv = ''[[Hotel Transylvania: The Series]]'' (2017–present) |plays = |vgs = {{ubl|''[[#Video games|Hotel Transylvania Social Game]]''|''[[#Video games|Hotel Transylvania]]''|''[[#Video games|Hotel Transylvania Dash]]''|''[[#Video games|Hotel Transylvania BooClips Deluxe App]]''|''[[#Video games|Hotel Transylvania 3: Monsters Overboard]]''}} |soundtracks = {{ubl|''[[Hotel Transylvania#Soundtrack|Hotel Transylvania]]''|''[[Hotel Transylvania 2#Music|Hotel Transylvania 2]]''}} }} '''''Hotel Transylvania''''' is an American [[media franchise]] created by comedy writer [[Todd Durham]]. It consists of three theatrical films, three graphic novels and two short films produced by [[Sony Pictures Animation]], as well as a TV series broadcast on [[Disney Channel]] and several video games. The series consists of an [[ensemble cast]], usually led by the voices of [[Adam Sandler]], [[Andy Samberg]] and [[Selena Gomez]]. The first film, ''[[Hotel Transylvania]]'', was released in September 2012, [[Hotel Transylvania 2|a sequel]] was released in September 2015 and a third film, ''[[Hotel Transylvania 3: Summer Vacation]]'', was released in July 2018. The films have received mixed reviews from critics and grossed over $1.3 billion worldwide against a combined production budget of $245 million. == Origin == Comedy writer [[Todd Durham]] conceived and created a [[Bible (screenwriting)|bible]] for a [[multimedia franchise]] called ''Hotel Transylvania'', consisting of several films, television series, video games, toys, books, merchandising, hotel chain, and theme park. After authoring the book of the same name, he took the package unsolicited to Columbia Pictures and set it up at Sony Pictures Animation where he became the first screenwriter on the project.{{Cite web|url=http://www.visualhollywood.com/movies_2012/hotel_transylvania/notes.pdf|title=Production Notes - Hotel Transylvania|last=|first=|date=|website=|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}{{Cite web|url=http://www.sonypicturesanimation.com/pastfilms.php?s=hotelt|title=Sony Pictures Animation - Hotel Transylvania|last=|first=|date=|website=|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}{{Cite web|url=https://www.facebook.com/HotelT/|title=Official Website - Hotel Transylvania|last=|first=|date=|website=|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}} == Feature films == === ''Hotel Transylvania'' (2012) === {{Main|Hotel Transylvania}} ''[[Hotel Transylvania]]'' was released on September 28, 2012, and is about Dracula and his daughter Mavis (played by [[Adam Sandler]] and [[Selena Gomez]] respectively), at the hotel. They meet a human named Jonathan ([[Andy Samberg]]), who Mavis instantly loves and eventually dates, despite Dracula's attempts to keep Jonathan away from his daughter. === ''Hotel Transylvania 2'' (2015) === {{Main|Hotel Transylvania 2}} ''[[Hotel Transylvania 2]]'' was released on September 25, 2015, and is about Mavis and Johnny, who have a half-human/half-vampire son named Dennis. Mavis thinks Hotel Transylvania isn't the right place to raise Dennis and wants to raise him in California. When Dracula is disappointed that Dennis does not have any vampire abilities, he helps his friends make his grandson a vampire. === ''Hotel Transylvania 3: Summer Vacation'' (2018) === {{Main|Hotel Transylvania 3: Summer Vacation}} In November 2015, Sony Pictures Animation announced that ''Hotel Transylvania 3'' would be released on September 21, 2018.{{cite web|last1=Lesnick|first1=Silas|title=Hotel Transylvania 3 Opens Its Doors in 2018!|url=http://www.comingsoon.net/movies/news/628529-hotel-transylvania-3-2018#/slide/1|publisher=ComingSoon.net|accessdate=November 3, 2015|date=November 2, 2015}} This was later resolved during early 2017 when the new release date was pushed forward to July 13, 2018. Despite previously leaving the series to develop other projects, Genndy Tartakovsky returned as director for this installment.{{cite web|author=Amid Amidi |url=http://www.cartoonbrew.com/feature-film/genndy-tartakovsky-isnt-done-hotel-transylvania-will-direct-third-film-franchise-140820.html |title=Genndy Tartakovsky Isn’t Done With ‘Hotel Transylvania,’ Will Direct Third Film in Franchise |publisher=Cartoonbrew.com |date=June 20, 2016|accessdate=June 20, 2016}}{{cite web|last1=Roberts|first1=Sheila|title=20 Things to Know About ‘Hotel Transylvania 2′|url=http://collider.com/hotel-transylvania-2-20-things-to-know-about-the-sequel/|publisher=Collider.com|accessdate=November 3, 2015|date=September 25, 2015}} The third film is about Dracula unwittingly falling for Ericka, a descendant of monster hunter [[Abraham Van Helsing|Van Helsing]], while on a cruise ship with his family.{{cite news|last1=Moore|first1=Debi|title=Synopsis and More Details on Hotel Transylvania 3 - Dread Central|url=https://www.dreadcentral.com/news/207350/synopsis-details-hotel-transylvania-3/|accessdate=19 January 2017|work=Dread Central|date=18 January 2017}} It is the first film in the series not to be released in September, as well as the first one not to feature the hotel as its main setting. == Television series == {{Main|Hotel Transylvania: The Series}} A television series based on the film premiered on June 25, 2017. Developed and produced by [[Nelvana Limited]], in partnership with Sony Pictures Animation, the prequel series focuses on the teenage years of Mavis and her friends at the Hotel Transylvania.{{cite news|last1=Steinberg|first1=Brian|title=Nelvana, Sony Pictures Animation Ready ‘Hotel Transylvania’ For TV|url=https://variety.com/2015/tv/news/nelvana-sony-pictures-animation-hotel-transylvania-tv-1201539674/|accessdate=November 3, 2015|work=Variety|date=July 14, 2015}} [[Sony Pictures Television]] handles distribution in the United States, while Nelvana distributes the series outside the United States. It is airing on the [[Disney Channel]] worldwide.{{cite web|last1=Pederson|first1=Erik|title=Sony Animation Dates ‘Hotel Transylvania 3’, ‘Emojimovie’ & More; ‘Ghostbusters’ TV Series Set|url=http://deadline.com/2016/06/hotel-transylvania-3-emoji-movie-ghostbusters-sony-animation-1201775965/|publisher=Deadline|accessdate=June 21, 2016|date=June 20, 2016}} == Short films == === ''Goodnight Mr. Foot'' === ''Goodnight Mr. Foot'' is a traditionally animated short film based on ''Hotel Transylvania'', featuring Bigfoot from the film. Premiering in time for Halloween, on October 26, 2012, the short was shown exclusively in [[Regal Entertainment Group|Regal Entertainment Group Cinemas]], before the theatrical shows of ''Hotel Transylvania''. As [[Sony Pictures Animation]]'s first traditionally animated film, it was written and directed by [[Genndy Tartakovsky]] himself, who also animated the short with the help of [[Rough Draft Studios]]. Animated in the style of [[Bob Clampett]], [[Tex Avery]] and [[Chuck Jones]],{{cite news|title=No Trick, Big Halloween Treat from Sony Pictures Animation's HOTEL TRANSYLVANIA Director Genndy Tartakovsky|url=http://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/no-trick-big-halloween-treat-from-sony-pictures-animations-hotel-transylvania-director-genndy-tartakovsky-175869981.html|accessdate=November 3, 2015|newspaper=PR Newswire|date=October 25, 2012|author=Sony Pictures Animation}} Tartakovsky created the short in four weeks during the final production stages of the main film.{{cite news|last=Beck|first=Jerry|title=Sony Releases Genndy Tartakovsky’s new short "Goodnight Mr. Foot"|url=http://www.cartoonbrew.com/animators/genndy-tartakovskys-new-short-goodnight-mr-foot-72407.html|accessdate=November 3, 2015|newspaper=[[Cartoon Brew]]|date=October 25, 2012}} Bigfoot (who had a non-speaking role in ''Hotel Transylvania'') was voiced by [[Corey Burton]] while the [[Witchcraft|Witch]] [[Maid]] was voiced by [[Rose Abdoo]]. Both voice actors provided additional voices in ''Hotel Transylvania''.{{cite news|last=Alexander|first=Bryan|title=New Bigfoot sighting in 'Hotel Transylvania' short film|url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/life/movies/2012/10/24/hotel-transylvania-goodnight-mr-foot/1649599/|accessdate=November 3, 2015|newspaper=USA Today|date=October 24, 2012}} Taking place before the events of ''Hotel Transylvania'', the short stars Bigfoot, whose rest in Hotel Transylvania is being constantly disturbed by an overly enthusiastic witch maid. === ''Puppy!'' === ''Puppy!'' is a [[computer animation|CG-animated]] [[fantasy comedy]] [[short film]] based on ''Hotel Transylvania'', featuring Dennis (voiced by Asher Blinkoff) from ''[[Hotel Transylvania 2]]'', with the additional voices of [[Selena Gomez]], reprising her role as Mavis, [[Andy Samberg]] as Jonathan, and [[Adam Sandler]] as Dracula. The film is written and directed by veteran director of the ''Hotel Transylvania'' movies, [[Genndy Tartakovsky]], and is shown in theaters alongside ''[[The Emoji Movie]]'', which was released in the United States on July 28, 2017.{{cite web|url=http://deadline.com/2017/01/sony-pictures-animation-the-emoji-movie-spider-man-hotel-transylvania-3-the-star-news-1201889122/|title=Sony Pictures Animation Details Upcoming Slate, Including Julia Roberts’ ‘Smurfs’ Role|date=January 18, 2017|accessdate=January 20, 2017}} The film is set in the hotel, as Dennis is given a monster-sized pet, and the hotel learns to cope with it.{{cite web|url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/scottmendelson/2017/01/19/sony-pictures-animation-unveils-spider-man-hotel-transylvania-3-smurfs-and-more/#50b030351b8d|title=Sony Pictures Animation Unveils 'Spider-Man,' 'Hotel Transylvania 3,' 'Smurfs' And More|date=January 19, 2017|accessdate=January 20, 2017}} The short is a sneak preview of the third film, ''[[Hotel Transylvania 3: Summer Vacation]]'', which was released on July 13, 2018. ==Reception== ===Box office performance=== {| class="wikitable" width="99%" border="1" style="text-align: center;" ! rowspan="2" | Film ! rowspan="2" | Release date ! colspan="3" | Box office gross ! colspan="2" text="wrap" | Box office ranking ! rowspan="2" | Budget (millions) ! rowspan="2" | Reference |- ! North America ! Other territories ! Worldwide ! All time North America ! All time worldwide |- | ''Hotel Transylvania'' | September 28, 2012 | $148,313,048 | $210,062,555 | $358,375,603 | #350 | #329 | $85 | {{cite web|title=Hotel Transylvania|url=http://www.boxofficemojo.com/movies/?id=hoteltransylvania.htm|publisher=Box Office Mojo|accessdate=February 25, 2013}} |- | ''Hotel Transylvania 2'' | September 25, 2015 | $169,700,110 | $303,526,848 | $473,226,958 | #267 | #210 | rowspan="2" | $80 | {{cite web |url=http://www.boxofficemojo.com/movies/?id=hoteltransylvania2.htm |title=Hotel Transylvania 2 (2015) |work=Box Office Mojo |accessdate=November 3, 2015}} |- | ''Hotel Transylvania 3:
Summer Vacation'' | July 13, 2018 | $166,941,006 | $342,300,000 | $510,864,621 | #294 | #194 |{{cite web|url=http://www.boxofficemojo.com/movies/?id=hoteltransylvania3.htm|title=''Hotel Transylvania Released | September 28, 2012 | September 25, 2015 | July 13, 2018 | June 25, 2017 – present |} == Chronology == # ''[[Hotel Transylvania: The Series]]'' (2017–present) # ''[[Hotel Transylvania#Goodnight Mr. Foot|Goodnight Mr. Foot]]'' (2012) # ''[[Hotel Transylvania]]'' (2012) # ''[[Hotel Transylvania 2]]'' (2015) # ''[[Hotel Transylvania (franchise)#Puppy!|Puppy!]]'' (2017) # ''[[Hotel Transylvania 3: Summer Vacation]]'' (2018) == Video games == A social game based on the film, titled ''Hotel Transylvania Social Game'' and made by Sony Pictures Interactive, was released on August 15, 2012. The game allows players to create their own Hotel Transylvania, where they must take care of the hotel's guests.{{cite news|title=Sony Pictures Interactive Opens a Hotel Game on Facebook|url=http://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/sony-pictures-interactive-opens-a-hotel-game-on-facebook-166334316.html|accessdate=November 3, 2015|newspaper=PR Newswire|date=August 15, 2012|author=Sony Pictures Interactive}} Another video game, titled ''Hotel Transylvania'', developed by [[WayForward Technologies]] and published by GameMill Entertainment, was released on September 18, 2012, for [[Nintendo DS]] and [[Nintendo 3DS]] at retail.{{cite news|title=GameMill Entertainment Goes Hollywood With Sony Pictures Animation's Hotel Transylvania; Coming Soon To Nintendo DS And Nintendo 3DS|url=http://www.gamasutra.com/view/pressreleases/174560/GAMEMILL_ENTERTAINMENT_GOES_HOLLYWOOD_WITH_SONY_PICTURESANIMATIONrsquoS_HOTEL_TRANSYLVANIA_COMING_SOON_TO_NINTENDO_DSand_NINTENDO_3DS.php|accessdate=November 3, 2015|newspaper=Gamasutra|date=July 23, 2012}}{{cite web|title=Hotel Transylvania NDS|url=https://www.amazon.com/dp/B00847PAZQ/|publisher=Amazon|accessdate=November 3, 2015}} The game was also released in the [[Nintendo eShop]] in North America on November 15, 2012.{{cite web|url=http://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20121115005562/en/Nintendo-News-Nintendo-Download-Highlights-Digital-Content-Nintendo/ |title=Nintendo News: Nintendo Download Highlights New Digital Content for Nintendo Systems |publisher=Business Wire |accessdate=November 3, 2015}} A mobile game, titled ''Hotel Transylvania Dash'', developed by Sony Pictures Consumer Products Inc. and [[PlayFirst]], was released to [[App Store (iOS)|iTunes App Store]] on September 20, 2012. The game is a variation of ''Hotel Dash'' and features the film's art and characters.{{cite news|last=Zahed|first=Ramin|title=Sony to Launch 'Hotel Transylvania' Mobile Game|url=http://www.animationmagazine.net/licensing/sony-to-launch-hotel-transylvania-mobile-game/|accessdate=November 3, 2015|newspaper=Animation Magazine|date=July 17, 2012}} A mobile digital storybook app, titled ''Hotel Transylvania BooClips Deluxe'', developed by Castle Builders and Sony Pictures Animation, was released on the [[App Store (iOS)|iTunes App Store]], Nook Store, Google Play for Android, iBookstore, Microsoft's Metro, and for PC and Mac via BooClips, both in English and in Spanish, on September 20, 2012.{{cite press release| author=Castle Builders |title=Castle Builders (IL) Launches Hotel Transylvania BooClips Deluxe App With Interactive Storybook and Cookbook Based on Sony Pictures Animation’s Family Comedy|url=http://www.booclips.com/Books/Assets/Castle%20Builders%20-%20%20SONY%20Hotel%20Transylvania%20PR.pdf|accessdate=November 3, 2015|publisher=BooClips.com |date=September 14, 2011}} A third video game based on ''[[Hotel Transylvania 3: Summer Vacation]]'', ''Hotel Transylvania 3 Monsters Overboard'', published by Outright Games, was released on July 13, 2018. ==Theme park attractions == ''Hotel Transylvania'' is a [[dark ride]] that has been featured at the Columbia Pictures zone at [[Motiongate Dubai]] since late 2016.{{cite news|last1=MacDonald|first1=Brady|title=What to expect at Dubai's 'Hollywood in the desert' theme park|url=http://www.latimes.com/travel/themeparks/la-trb-motiongate-bollywood-legoland-dubai-20151023-story.html|accessdate=November 1, 2016|work=Los Angeles Times|date=October 23, 2015}} == References == {{Reflist|30em}} == External links == * {{IMDb title|0837562|Hotel Transylvania}} * {{IMDb title|2510894|Hotel Transylvania 2}} * {{IMDb title|5220122|Hotel Transylvania 3: Summer Vacation}} {{Portal bar|Cartoon|2010s|Animation}} {{Sony Pictures Animation}} {{Hotel Transylvania}} [[Category:Animated film series]] [[Category:Film revision.comment: Updating URL format for [[The New York Times]]
revision.text:
'''Hyman Kaplan''', or '''H*Y*M*A*N K*A*P*L*A*N''' as he habitually signs himself, is a [[fictional character]] in a series of well-received, [[humor]]ous stories by [[Leo Rosten]], published under the [[pseudonym]] "Leonard Q. Ross" in ''[[The New Yorker]]'' in the 1930s and later collected in two books, ''The Education of H*Y*M*A*N K*A*P*L*A*N'' and ''The Return of H*Y*M*A*N K*A*P*L*A*N''.<ref name=rubin> {{citation|title=The Comic Imagination in American Literature|page=398|editor=Louis Decimus Rubin Jr.|publisher=Voice of America|year=1973|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=_7FZAAAAMAAJ|isbn=978-0-8135-0758-3}}</ref> Rosten noted that he was frequently asked if Mr Kaplan was his [[alter ego]], and that he often felt it was the other way around.
The first collection (''Education'', 1937) was a "close second" for one U.S. [[National Book Award]] [[List of winners of the National Book Award#1935 to 1941|in 1938]].<ref name=nyt1938> Staff (March 2, 1938), "Booksellers Give Prize to 'Citadel': Cronin's Work About Doctors Their Favorite--'Mme. Curie' Gets Non-Fiction Award TWO OTHERS WIN HONORS Fadiman Is 'Not Interested' in What Pulitzer Committee Thinks of Selections", ''The New York Times'', p. 14</ref><ref group=lower-alpha> For 1937 the [[American Booksellers Association]] gave awards in four categories, of which ''Hyman Kaplan'' may have been a contender for the Fiction, the Bookseller Discovery, or the Most Original Book, most likely the latter (not the Nonfiction award). Next-day coverage by ''The New York Times'' named the four Awards and their winners first, of course, and later named the four "close seconds" in order that cannot match. The Most Original Book and ''The Education of Hyman Kaplan'' were both fourth on their respective lists.</ref> The second collection (''Return'', 1959) was one of eighteen [[National Book Award for Fiction]] finalists in 1960.<ref name=nba1960>[http://www.nationalbook.org/nba1960 "National Book Awards – 1960"]. NBF. Retrieved 2012-04-05.</ref>
Rosten rewrote the two books as one, with many changes, published as ''O K*A*P*L*A*N! My K*A*P*L*A*N!'' in 1976.
The books were [[theatrical adaptation|adapted as a]] [[Musical theatre|musical]] play produced in 1968, namely ''[[The Education of H*Y*M*A*N K*A*P*L*A*N]]''.<ref name=ibd> [http://www.ibdb.com/show.php?id=3279 Internet Broadway Database]</ref>
==Hyman Kaplan==
Mr Kaplan is an immigrant and a pupil at a New York night class in English. He is extremely diligent and enthusiastic, but seems completely incapable of learning: the teacher, Mr Parkhill, is eventually driven to conclude that, although Mr Kaplan admits that English has rules – "good rules, sensible rules" – he is quite unable to admit that the rules apply to ''him.'' (In ''The Return of H*Y*M*A*N K*A*P*L*A*N'', Kaplan's English pronunciation has improved substantially between semesters.)
Mr Kaplan is extroverted and highly assertive, particularly when his moral sense has been outraged by some perceived injustice in class or in American history, and he frequently gets into noisy disagreements with other members of the class.
Mr Kaplan usually signs his name in colored crayon with green stars between red letters outlined in blue.<ref name=vangelder> {{citation|url=https://www.nytimes.com/1937/08/29/archives/a-mr-malaprop-in-the-bronx-idiom-the-education-of-hyman-kaplan-by.html|publisher=''The New York Times''|title=A Mr. Malaprop in the Bronx Idiom|author=Robert van Gelder|date=August 29, 1937|page=89}}</ref> In the last story of all, "Mr K*A*P*L*A*N the Eumoirous", he signs a note to his teacher simply "Hyman Kaplan", but addresses it to "Mr P*A*R*K*H*I*L*L". Mr Parkhill wonders if he will ever again be so honored.
Mr Kaplan was born in [[Kiev]], has lived in America for fifteen years, and claims (on [[Columbus Day]]) that his birthday is October 12. From his pronunciation of English (the characters' various idioms are a major source of the stories' humor), it appears that Mr Kaplan's native language is [[Yiddish language|Yiddish]]. This would seem to be confirmed when Kaplan calls flowers "bloomers", and a fellow student reminds him not to mix up two languages, leading the teacher to reflect that Mr Kaplan's native language refers to flowers as ''blumen''.
== The teacher ==
'''Mr Parkhill''' is the point-of-view character in the stories, a staid, kind-hearted, mild-mannered teacher with a tendency to think of his pupils in terms of classical literature. Mr Parkhill is rigorously fair-minded, often to his own detriment when faced with Mr Kaplan's very individual brand of logic. He is also a lonely and rather tragic character: when the class present him with a new briefcase with the initials "M.P." on it as a birthday present, he is at first puzzled since his first name does not begin with M; then realizes that the letters stand for "Mr Parkhill" and that he cannot remember the last time anyone addressed him by his first name.
== Other members of the class ==
*'''Mr Norman Bloom''' (in the first book) and '''Mr Reuben Plonsky''' (in the second book; renamed Olansky in the combined version), both of whom are better than Mr Kaplan at grasping the rules of English, but who somehow end up on the losing side of the arguments that erupt between them. *'''Miss Rose Mitnick''', a quiet, shy young woman whose grasp of English is almost perfect, but who generally withers before the force of Mr Kaplan's rhetorical passion. Eventually she starts a relationship with the ebullient '''Nathan P. Nathan'''. *'''Mrs Sadie Moskowitz''', characterized by Mr Parkhill as "the [[Niobe]] of the beginners' grade", a large, lugubrious middle-aged lady who is baffled by the English language and spends much of the time asleep, waking only to punctuate a particularly intimidating fact with a despairing exclamation of "Oy!" *'''Miss Olga Tarnova''', an emotional old Russian woman, a retired ballerina who recalls the Imperial days with nostalgia and despises Communism. Her compositions often deal either with her former life or with her interest in [[Spiritualism]]. *'''Mr Sam Pinsky''', a loyal ally of Mr Kaplan. *'''Miss Carmen Caravello''', an Italian woman prone to loud disagreement with Mr Kaplan. *'''Gus Matsoukas''', the only Greek in the class, whose dogged pursuit of English is accompanied by near-constant muttering to himself. His one moment of enthusiasm comes when Mr Parkhill begins pointing out how many English words have Greek roots. He eventually returns to Greece.
==Bibliography==
Hyman Kaplan is featured in three books by Rosten.<ref name=loc>[http://lccn.loc.gov/n80051100 "Rosten, Leo, 1908–1997"]. Library of Congress Authorities. [[Library of Congress]]. Retrieved 2012-04-05. (Linked to Library of Congress Online Catalog listings for Rosten.)</ref>
* ''The education of H*Y*M*A*N K*A*P*L*A*N'' by Leonard Q. Ross. New York: Harcourt, Brace. 1937. PZ3.R7386 Ed <!-- No Subjects Available --> * ''The return of H*Y*M*A*N K*A*P*L*A*N''. New York: Harper. 1959. (OCoLC)391898; PZ3.R7386 Re <!-- no mention of Leonard Q. Ross --><!-- No Subjects Available --> * ''O K*A*P*L*A*N! My K*A*P*L*A*N!''. New York: Harper & Row. 1976. {{ISBN|0-06-013676-6}}; PZ3.R7386 Oad — "New, completely rewritten H*y*m*a*n K*a*p*l*a*n, combining ''The education'' and ''The return'' with a new introduction." (Library of Congress Online Catalog) <!-- Subjects: Immigrants --Fiction. Form/Genre: Humorous stories. -->

{{italic title}} {{About|the sketch revue |the book|Settling Accounts: In at the Death}}
'''''In At The Death''''' was a sketch revue performed at The Bush Theatre, London in 1978, most notable for being the first time that future colleagues [[Victoria Wood]] and [[Julie Walters]] would work together.<ref>{{cite web |last=Wood |first=Victoria |authorlink=Victoria Wood |coauthors= |title=Theatre Royal Haymarket Victoria Wood biography |work= |publisher=prestel.co.uk |date= |url=http://www.trh.co.uk/acornantiques/Victoria_Wood.asp |format= |doi= |accessdate=2007-08-27 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070810224647/http://www.trh.co.uk/acornantiques/Victoria_Wood.asp |archivedate=2007-08-10 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref>
The show is described in Neil Brandwood's biography of Wood as an "alternative theatre company's sketch show about mortality."
After being impressed by Wood's songwriting skills, director Dusty Hughes invited her to be part of a six strong writing team. The topicality of the review was also deemed suitable for her, as she'd just finished writing weekly topical songs on the [[BBC1]] consumer show ''[[That's Life!]]''.<ref> {{cite book | last = Brandwood | first = Neil | title= Victoria Wood – The Biography | edition = 1st | year = 2002 | publisher = Boxtree | location = London | isbn = 1-85227-982-6 | pages =68 }} </ref>
Other writers included were [[Ken Campbell]], [[Snoo Wilson]], Ken Hutchinson and Nigel Baldwin. They were asked to write short items based on the weeks newspapers around the theme of death. Campbell took stories from the ''Malaysian New Strait Times'', Baldwin the ''Holyhead and Anglesey Chronicle'', but to be more accessible, Wood drew her inspiration strictly from the tabloids.
Wood wrote six items in the first half of the show, including a requiem for [[Guy the Gorilla]], a song about 'battered wives' (inspired by an article in ''[[The Sun (United Kingdom)|The Sun]]'' about domestic violence). A song called 'Road Blocks' about a motorcycle accident, and a melancholy number titled '[http://www2.prestel.co.uk/cello/LoveSong.htm Love Song]'. The second half featured a sketch by Wood called 'Dear Mum', about a middle classed woman who refuses to visit her mother in hospital, and also a harrowing song titled 'Abortion.'<ref> {{cite book | last = Brandwood | first = Neil | title= Victoria Wood – The Biography | edition = 1st | year = 2002 | publisher = Boxtree | location = London | isbn = 1-85227-982-6 | pages =69 }} </ref>
In the cast was Julie Walters. Having only met Wood briefly eight years before, the two hit it off immediately. Wood also performed in the show, but said later "There was a sketch set in Belfast and I couldn’t do the accent, so they made me a deaf mute." <ref>{{cite web|url=http://www2.prestel.co.uk/cello/LoveSong.htm Love Song/Victoria_Wood.asp|title=Love Song introduction by Victoria Wood|publisher=Robert England|date=2007-03-24}}</ref>
Wood received much critical acclaim for her work on the show though. The ''[[Daily Telegraph]]'' said her songs "successfully blend a gallows humour with an unexpected touch of humanity", and [[Time Out (company)|Time Out]] wrote "Victoria Wood's musical epigrams brilliantly embroider the action".
The revue was initially too short, and making up the shortfall, Wood discovered a new talent, writing comedy sketches. The sketch 'Sex' was set in a [[Manchester]] library and starred Walters as a teenage girl who thinks she's pregnant asking Alison Fiske (as the librarian) advice. As almost the only comedy in the show, it came as a welcome relief to the audience and went down extremely well. During the writing process, Wood said she discovered her true voice. "It was the first thing I'd written with proper jokes and I thought "aha!" I'd suddenly found something I could do. It was a blinding flash, like learning a new language." ''[[The Times]]'' said of the sketch that she was a "great discovery" who "got more poetry out of Manchester speech than I had heard for years".<ref> {{cite book | last = Brandwood | first = Neil | title= Victoria Wood – The Biography | edition = 1st | year = 2002 | publisher = Boxtree | location = London | isbn = 1-85227-982-6 | pages =70 }} </ref>
The cast also included Godfrey Jackman, [[Philip Jackson (actor)|Philip Jackson]] and [[Clive Merrison]]. The production ran from 13 July to 6 August 1978.
Due to Wood's acclaim, then theatre director [[David Leland]] commissioned her first play ''[[Talent (1978 play)|Talent]]''.<ref> {{cite book | last = Brandwood | first = Neil | title= Victoria Wood – The Biography | edition = 1st | year = 2002 | publisher = Boxtree | location = London | isbn = 1-85227-982-6 | pages =68 }} </ref>
==References== {{Reflist|2}}
==External links== * [https://web.archive.org/web/20070927002333/http://www.bushtheatre.co.uk/writers_list.html Bush Theatre official website]
{{Victoria Wood}}
[[Category:1978 plays]] [[Category:Revues]] [[Category:Satire]]

{{About|is about iriver Inc|its brand and marketing division|iriver}}{{Lowercase}}{{Infobox company | name = iriver Inc | former_names = ReignCom | trading_name = | logo = Iriver logo.PNG | logo_size = 145 | logo_alt = A bright orange logotype, all uppercase, saying "Iriver" in a syncopated font. | logo_caption = The current logo as of August 2016. | type = [[Public company|Public]] | traded_as = {{Kosdaq|060570}} | founded = {{start date and age|1999}} | founder = Duk-Jun Yang | area_served = Worldwide | key_people = Duk-Jun Yang ([[Chief executive officer|CEO]]) | industry = [[Consumer electronics]]
[[music industry|Music]]{{cite web|url=http://www.koreaherald.com/view.php?ud=20180131000775|title=SKT readying new music service with K-pop heavyweights|publisher=[[The Korea Herald]]|accessdate=February 24, 2018}} | revenue = {{increase}} [[United States dollar|US$]]51,649{{cite web|url=https://finance.yahoo.com/quote/060570.KQ?ltr=1|title=Iriver|publisher=[[Yahoo Finance]]|accessdate=30 August 2016}} | revenue_year = 2015 | operating_income = {{decrease}} US$280 | income_year = 2015 | net_income = {{decrease}} US$589 | net_income_year = 2015 | assets = {{decrease}} US$56,081 | assets_year = 2015 | parent = [[SK Telecom]] | divisions = [[Iriver|iriver Limited]]
iriver China Limited {{Cite web|url=http://www.iriver.com/company/contact.asp|title=Iriver Global - Contact Info|website=Iriver Global|access-date=2018-04-24}} | subsid = {{plainlist| *[[Astell&Kern]] *Yurion *Funcake Entertainment Services }} | homepage = [http://www.iriver.com iriver.com] (Global)
{{URL|iriver.co.kr}} (Korean) }} '''iriver Inc''' is an [[electronics]] and [[entertainment]] company founded in 1999 originally as '''ReignCom'''. Headquartered in United States, it is the parent company of South Korean-based [[MP3 player]] manufacturer [[iriver|iriver Limited]], as well as Yurion and Funcake Entertainment Services. Since 2014, it is a subsidiary of [[SK Telecom]]. == History == Seven former [[Samsung]] executives created the company in 1999 and made its [[Initial public offering|IPO]] on the [[KOSDAQ]], a Korean stock exchange, in 2003. Duk-Jun Yang, one of the founder, became the CEO of the company. ReignCom announced in May 2006 that it would adjust its focus toward handheld mobile gaming. It has reported sluggish sales for its music player business, including a loss of 35.58 billion (US$36.68 million) in 2005, compared with a net profit of 43.46 billion in 2004. In 2009, ReignCom was renamed as Iriver. === Entry into music === On January 31, 2018, Iriver announced its entry into the Korean music industry. Together with parent SK Telecom and music labels [[S.M. Entertainment]], [[JYP Entertainment]] and [[Big Hit Entertainment]], the company will launch a new [[online music store]] in the second half of 2018. == Distributed labels == As of February 2018: * [[S.M. Entertainment|SM Entertainment]] (including [[J Storm]] and [[Avex Trax]] releases) ** [[Mystic Entertainment]] (select releases only; co-distributed with [[kakao M]]) ** [[Woollim Entertainment]] (select releases only; co-distributed with [[kakao M]]) * [[JYP Entertainment]] * [[Big Hit Entertainment]] == References == {{Reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.Reigncom.com ReignCom Homepage] {{SK Group}} {{K-pop}} [[Category:Electronics companies of South Korea]] [[Category:Entertainment companies of South Korea]] [[Category:South Korean record labels]] [[Category:Iriver Inc| ]] [[Category:SK subsidiaries]] {{industry-company-stub}}

revision.text:
'' '''Irène''' '' is a tragedy in five acts by [[Voltaire]], and his penultimate play. It was written in 1776-1777 and premiered in Paris on March 16, 1778.<ref name="Trousson2015"/>
==Composition== [[File:Voltaire Irene Edition Originale Paris 1779.jpg|thumb|Original Edition of Voltaire's Irène, Paris 1779]] [[File:Couronnement de Voltaire.jpg|thumb|The crowning of Voltaire’s bust after the sixth performance of Irène, 30 March 1778]] [[File:Moreau Voltaire Irene.jpg|thumb|right|[[Jean-Michel Moreau]]: Illustration of Irène, 1786]] Recent scholarship has suggested that the original inspiration for the story, though not its setting, was an account of the death of a young woman in China who prayed for death rather than betrayal of her faith. At the time he was working on the early versions of the play, Voltaire was reading ''Mémoires concernant l’histoire, les sciences, les arts, les mœurs, les usages, etc., des Chinois'' by the [[Jesuit]] priest [[Jean Joseph Marie Amiot]] and corresponding with [[d'Alembert]] and [[Diderot]] about what he read. The theme of a woman who chooses death before disloyalty is also classically [[Confucian]].<ref name="Hua Meng"/>
The play was written as part of Voltaire’s plan to make a triumphal return to Paris after having spent nearly twenty years in self-imposed exile in [[Ferney-Voltaire|Ferney]]. He wished to end his life with a great theatrical success that would secure his position for posterity and prevent his enemies from taking any action against him. He therefore set about writing a classical tragedy that would affirm his reputation and enable his return to the centre of French cultural life.<ref name="Pearson2010">{{cite book|author=Roger Pearson|title=Voltaire Almighty: A Life in Pursuit of Freedom|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=FbklD47SK1UC&pg=PT336|date=15 December 2010|publisher=A&C Black|isbn=978-1-4088-2080-3|pages=336–7}}</ref>
To this end, in the early part of 1777, Voltaire was working on two plays at the same time; one was ''Irène'' and the other was ''[[Agathocle]]''.<ref name="WS">{{cite web |title=Agathocle |url=https://fr.m.wikisource.org/wiki/Agathocle |last=Moland |first=Louis |authorlink= |coauthors= |year=1877 |publisher=Garnier |page=389}}</ref> Correspondence with his friend [[Charles-Augustin de Ferriol d'Argental|d'Argental]] indicated that he was initially unsure which would be more successful; he gradually came to consider that ''Irène'' would work better on stage, and it was indeed ''Irène'' that was rehearsed and performed while he was alive.<ref name="WS"/> Having previously sent him the manuscript of ''Agathocle'', he wrote to d'Argental on 25 October ‘I'm sending you something (''Irène'') more passionate, more theatrical, and more interesting.'<ref name="Trousson2015">{{cite book|author=Raymond Trousson|title=Voltaire|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=VLtSCwAAQBAJ&pg=PT499|date=2015|publisher=Tallandier|isbn=979-10-210-0908-0|page=499}}</ref>
The original working title for ''Irène'' was ''Alexis Comnène'' and it was only in a later revision that the title and the focus of the plot was changed to the heroine. The action is very loosely based in the historical setting of the overthrowing of the Byzantine emperor [[Nikephoros III Botaneiates]] by [[Alexios I Komnenos]] in the year 1081.<ref name="Pearson2010"/>
Voltaire also wrote a letter to the [[Académie Française]], which he prefaced to the tragedy. In this letter he emphasized the independence and importance of French poetry in relation to the English tradition in the wake of [[Shakespeare]], referring to a debate launched by [[Louis-Sébastien Mercier]] and [[Michel-Jean Sedaine]].
==Action== Irène, compelled by her family to marry Nicéphore, Emperor of Constantinople, loves the prince Alexis. Alexis, returning victorious from campaign to Constantinople against the will of the Emperor, wishes to declare his love to Irène, but Nicéphore orders him to leave the city. Alexis refuses, so the Emperor orders his arrest and execution. Warned by his attaché Memnon, Alexis and his army confront the emperor. Defeated by Alexis but spared, Nicéphore is killed by the people. Alexis ascends the throne. As a widow, Irène is then obliged to enter a convent by her father Léonce. Irène renounces her love for Alexis at her father’s insistence. Furious that Léonce will deprive him of his love, Alexis puts the father in chains. Irène appeals for his release and then kills herself, unable to reconcile the claims of love and duty.<ref name="gens-de-lettres..1778">{{cite book|author=Une Société de gens-de-lettres..|title=L'Esprit des journaux franc̜ais et étrangers|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=Ng9cAAAAcAAJ&pg=PA293|year=1778|publisher=Valade|page=293}}</ref>
Voltaire himself remarked that people might think the play a comedy because 'people may laugh at a woman who takes her own life rather than sleep with the man who has conquered and murdered her husband, when she doesn't love the husband and absolutely adores the murderer.'<ref name="Pearson2010"/><ref name="Aldridge2015">{{cite book|author=Alfred Owen Aldridge|title=Voltaire and the Century of Light|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=bEl9BgAAQBAJ&pg=PA401|date=8 March 2015|publisher=Princeton University Press|isbn=978-1-4008-6695-3|page=401}}</ref> He also commented that "I had great hopes when beginning the work, but at the end I see nothing but ridicule... nothing can undo the failings of a subject which does not exist in nature.'<ref name="Hua Meng">{{cite book |title=Le Bonheur de la littérature. Variations critiques pour Béatrice Didier |chapter=Irène, une autre tragedie de Voltaire qui s'inspire de la Chine |date=2005 |publisher=Presses universitaires de France |location=Paris |pages=107-114 |doi=10.3917/puf.neef.2005.01.0107 |url= https://www.cairn.info/le-bonheur-de-la-litterature--9782130523031-page-107.htm |accessdate=28 October 2018}}</ref>
==Performances== The play was read through at Ferney on 23 October and first performed at Voltaire's private house theatre there for the wedding of the two of Voltaire's friends and protégés, the [[Charles, marquis de Villette|Marquis de Villette]] and [[Reine Philiberte de Varicourt]].<ref name="Trousson2015"/><ref name="Andrews1981">{{cite book|author=Wayne Andrews|title=Voltaire|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=gm6ADMDnXfoC&pg=PA145|year=1981|publisher=New Directions Publishing|isbn=978-0-8112-0802-4|page=145}}</ref> Its public premiere was on March 16, 1778 at the [[Comédie-Française]]. The cast was Vanhove (Nicéphore); (fr) [[:fr:François-René Molé|Molé]] (Alexis Comnène); (fr) [[:fr:Brizard (acteur)|Brizard]] (Léonce); [[Jacques Marie Boutet|Monvel]] (Memnon); Dusaulx (officier); Mme Vestris (Irène); Mlle Saint-Val cadette (Zoé).<ref>{{cite web |title=Irène |url=http://lagrange.comedie-francaise.fr/notice?ref=00003818&p=1 |website=lagrange.comedie-francaise.fr |publisher=Comédie Française |accessdate=28 October 2018}}</ref>
==Contemporary reception== Voltaire's appearance in Paris caused immense public excitement; he was hailed wherever he went and the success of his play was more a tribute to his public standing than to its artistic merits. The dress rehearsal on 14 March 1778 indicated that the play would not fail.<ref name="Andrews1981"/> The play opened on 16 March in the presence of [[Marie Antoinette]], though Voltaire was too ill to attend; messengers were dispatched to him at the end of each act to report the audience's reception.<ref name="Carlson">{{cite book|author=Marvin A. Carlson|title=Voltaire and the Theatre of the Eighteenth Century|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=OoIaRFoCG-4C&pg=PA152|year=1998|publisher=Greenwood Publishing Group|isbn=978-0-313-30302-9|page=152}}</ref>
For the sixth performance of the play on 21 March, the king's brother [[Charles X of France|the comte d'Artois]] sent the captain of his guards to congratulate Voltaire, who then attended the performance in person. The audience shouted demands for him to be crowned, upon which one of the actors placed a wreath of laurels on his head. 'My God! Do you want to kill me with glory?' he exclaimed, weeping tears of joy.<ref name="Andrews1981"/> The play was performed twice that evening, and the actors then inaugurated a bust of Voltaire in the theatre, which they also crowned.<ref>{{cite book|author=Frank Hall Standish|title=The Life of Voltaire: With Interesting Particulars Respecting His Death, and Anecdotes and Characters of His Contemporaries|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=TzhBAQAAIAAJ&pg=PA373|year=1821|publisher=J. Andrews|page=373}}</ref> After six further performances the play was taken off the stage.
==Printed versions== ''Irène'' was printed posthumously in Paris in 1779, with another imprint in Lausanne. In neither case is the name of the printer known.
==External links== *[https://fr.wikisource.org/wiki/Ir%C3%A8ne/%C3%89dition_Garnier/Ir%C3%A8ne original text (in French) of ''Irène''] *[http://voltaire.lire.ish-lyon.cnrs.fr/spip.php?article384 Literature on ''Irène'', Société des Etudes Voltairiennes]
==References== {{reflist}}
{{Voltaire|state=expanded}}

'''KC2XAK''' was the world's first [[Ultra High Frequency|UHF]] television station. It was simply a [[rebroadcaster|rebroadcast]]/[[broadcast translator]] [[transmitter]] of [[New York City, New York|New York City's]] WNBT (today’s [[WNBC]]), and broadcast on 529-535 MHz in [[Bridgeport, Connecticut]]. It went on the air on December 29, 1949.
The station's launch was code-named "'''Operation Bridgeport'''", as a test by [[RCA]] and [[NBC]], to determine if the UHF spectrum was feasible to use for communications and broadcasting.
The station used a 1 kW transmitter with a 20-dB [[antenna gain|gain antenna]] on a {{convert|210|ft|m|sing=on}} tower elevated {{convert|450|ft|m}} above average terrain. This resulted in an [[Effective Radiated Power]] of 10 kW.
'''Operation Bridgeport''' was apparently a success, but was shut down by RCA and NBC on August 23, 1952, after two and a half years of operation. [[Empire Coil]] purchased the KC2XAK transmitter, and the transmitter and support equipment was dismantled in Bridgeport under supervision of RCA. Dismantling began on August 25, and was shipped via truck and fast [[freight train]] to [[Portland, Oregon]]. It was re-assembled as a {{convert|250|ft|m|sing=on}} tower on Council Crest, more than {{convert|1000|ft|m}} above Portland on September 9, 1952. This became a transmitter for Portland's [[KPTV]] as well being the first commercial UHF television station in the country.
Although KC2XAK was the first UHF station on the air, it was an experimental station. The first full-fledged UHF commercial [[television station]] honor goes to [[KPTV]] in [[Portland, Oregon]], which broadcast on UHF Channel 27 in 1952, although it has operated on VHF Channel 12 since 1957.
Bridgeport is now covered [[terrestial television|over-the-air]] by WNBC, and the other [[Template:NYC TV|New York City broadcast stations]].
==See also== * [[Early television stations]] * [[History of television]] * [[List of experimental television stations]] * [[Narrow-bandwidth television]] * [[Oldest television station]] * [[Television systems before 1940]]
==References== {{Reflist}}
==External links== * [https://web.archive.org/web/20070729112034/http://www.ggninfo.com/May05.htm KC2XAK on gginfo.com]
{{NYC TV}}

revision.text:
'''King's Cup Elephant Polo''' is an [[elephant polo]] event played three times a year in [[Thailand]],<ref>{{cite news |last1=Sherwell |first1=Philip |title=Battle over elephant polo on eve of popular Bangkok tournament |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/asia/thailand/12187480/Battle-over-elephant-polo-on-eve-of-popular-Bangkok-tournament.html |accessdate=4 October 2018 |work=The Telegraph |date=2016-03-09}}</ref> [[Sri Lanka]], and [[Nepal]]. The event is sponsored by Anantara Hotels,<ref>{{cite web |title=Our Brands |url=https://www.minorhotels.com/en/brands |website=Minor Hotels|accessdate=4 October 2018}}</ref> a brand owned by the [[Minor Hotels|Minor Hotel Group]] of Bangkok, Thailand.<ref>{{cite news |title=Anantara announces dates to Bangkok’s 2018 King’s Cup Elephant Polo Tournament |url=https://www.tatnews.org/2017/11/anantara-announces-dates-bangkoks-2018-kings-cup-elephant-polo-tournament/ |accessdate=4 October 2018 |work=TAT News |publisher=Tourism Authority of Thailand (TAT) |date=2017-11-17 |format=Press release}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |last1=Dundup Sherpa Subirana |first1=Lobsang |title=Elephant Polo to Continue Despite Abuse |url=http://www.khaosodenglish.com/news/bangkok/2018/03/12/elephant-polo-to-continue-despite-abuse/ |accessdate=4 October 2018 |work=Khaosod English |date=2018-03-12}}</ref>
In each match, two teams compete. Each team consists of five humans and five elephants. There is no monetary prize. Sponsors have included [[Johnnie Walker]], [[PricewaterhouseCoopers|PwC]], [[Peroni Brewery|Peroni]], and [[IBM]]. PETA claims that at least eight other corporate sponsors have ended their support of the event due to its allegedly inhumane nature.<ref>{{cite news |title=Eight companies end sponsorship of elephant polo tournament after seeing abuse video|url=https://www.petaasia.com/media/eight-companies-end-sponsorship-of-elephant-polo-tournament-after-seeing-abuse-video/ |accessdate=4 October 2018 |publisher=PETA-Asia |date=2018-03-21 |format=Press release}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |last1=Dundup Sherpa Subirana |first1=Lobsang |title=Elephant Polo Organizers Vow Changes as Sponsors Pull Out |url=http://www.khaosodenglish.com/news/bangkok/2018/03/29/elephant-polo-organizers-vow-changes-as-sponsors-pull-out/ |accessdate=4 October 2018 |work=Khaosod English |date=2018-03-29}}</ref>
[[People for the Ethical Treatment of Animals]] (PETA) has targeted elephant polo as cruel and barbaric.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Baker |first1=Jason |title=On World Animal Day, it's time to end elephant polo |url=http://www.nationmultimedia.com/detail/opinion/30355759 |accessdate=4 October 2018 |work=The Nation |date=4 October 2018 |format=Opinion}}</ref> Allegations of animal cruelty surfaced in Thailand during the 2018 King's Cup Polo in Thailand.<ref>{{cite news |title=Video: Shocking expose of elephants beaten in extreme heat at Anantara Elephant Polo Tournament|url=https://www.petaasia.com/media/video-shocking-expose-of-elephants-beaten-in-extreme-heat-at-anantara-elephant-polo-tournament/ |accessdate=4 October 2018 |publisher=PETA Asia |date=2018-03-09 |format=Press release}}</ref>
The Thailand Elephant Polo Association announced in October 2018 that it will end polo matches in Thailand. A polo tournament had been held annually at Anantara Hotel Bangkok owned by [[Minor Hotels]].<ref>{{cite news |last1=Heinecke |first1=William E |authorlink=William Heinecke|title=Like PETA, Minor Hotels is serious about elephant welfare in Thailand |url=http://www.nationmultimedia.com/detail/opinion/30356000 |accessdate=8 October 2018 |work=The Nation |date=8 October 2018 |format=Opinion}}</ref>
==References== {{reflist}}
==External links== *[https://web.archive.org/web/20180427183624/http://www.anantaraelephantpolo.com/ Web Archive capture from 27 April 2018]
